page.title: 14Anstruther Discotheque
page.content: "Scamps"opened this year as the town's first permanent discotheque.It got its name because it used to be a scampi factory. It is furnished with green & black seats and carpets with "Scamps" written all over them. There are mirrors down one wall and small mirrors shaped like rabbit heads everywhere else. The dance floor is quite small with modern flashing lights. There is a digital screen and you can send messages through it. There are 3 televisions and a video camera which shows you on the screen. For our Junior Discos it costs 70p to get in and you can buy juice, chips and crisps. They run discos for all ages. The DJ's play fashionable and popular records like "Ghostbusters" by Ray Parker Jnr and "19"by Paul Hardcastle. They also play requests.
